unstructured.description: Histology: Part 1: Metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer (mCRPC) with histologic confirmation of adenocarcinoma. Adenocarcinoma with small-cell or neuroendocrine features is allowed. mCRPC is defined by prostate Cancer Working Group (PCWG )3 criteria. Part 2: mCRPC as defined above or pathologically confirmed metastatic renal cell carcinoma (RCC) as defined by world health organization (WHO) 2016 Classifications
Measurable or evaluable disease: Part 1: Either measurable or evaluable disease for prostate cancer. Part 2: At least one measurable lesion as per RECIST v1.1.
Evidence of disease progression on prior therapy that requires a new line of treatment

Participants with accessible lesions enrolled in selected pharmacokinetic (PK)/pharmacodynamics (PD) cohorts and in Part 2 must agree to undergo the mandatory fresh tumor biopsies, unless collection of the biopsy presents a safety risk

Less than 2 weeks between prior anticancer treatment (including radiotherapy) discontinuation and the first dose of study drug, and toxicities have not returned to Grade less than or equal to (<=) 1 or baseline
Prior treatment with prostate-specific membrane antigen (PSMA)-targeted therapy except for PSMA-targeted vaccine is permitted
Solid organ or bone marrow transplantation
Seizure or known condition that may predispose to seizure or intracranial masses
Other active malignancy requiring systemic treatment <=12 months prior to enrollment

official_title: A Phase 1, First-in-Human, Dose Escalation Study of JNJ-63898081, in Subjects With Advanced Stage Solid Tumors

outcome_measures.name: Duration of Response
outcome_measures.description: Duration of response (DOR) will be calculated from the date of initial documentation of a response (PR or better) to the date of first documented evidence of progressive disease, as defined in the disease-specific response criteria, or death due to any cause, whichever occurs first. Evaluation of prostate treatment response will be performed according to Prostate Cancer Working Group 3 (PCWG3).

outcome_measures.name: Objective Response Rate (ORR)
outcome_measures.description: ORR is defined as the proportion of participants who have a PR or better according to the disease-specific response criteria. Evaluation of prostate treatment response will be performed according to Prostate Cancer Working Group 3 (PCWG3).

outcome_measures.name: Part 1 and 2: Number of Participants with JNJ-63898081 Antibodies
outcome_measures.description: Anti-JNJ-63898081 antibodies will be evaluated in serum samples collected from all participants.

outcome_measures.name: Part 1 and 2: Systemic Cytokine Concentrations
outcome_measures.description: A panel of cytokines, including those proinflammatory ones, will be measured.

outcome_measures.name: Part 1 and Part 2: Number of Participants with Adverse Events (AEs) as a Measure of Safety and Tolerability
outcome_measures.description: An AE is any untoward medical occurrence in a participant participating in a clinical study that does not necessarily have a causal relationship with the pharmaceutical/biological agent under study.

outcome_measures.name: Part 1 and Part 2: Serum Concentrations of JNJ-63898081
outcome_measures.description: Serum samples will be analyzed to determine concentrations of JNJ-63898081 using a validated method.

outcome_measures.name: Part 1: Number of Participants with Dose-Limiting Toxicity (DLT)
outcome_measures.description: Number of participants with DLT will be assessed. The DLTs are specific adverse events and are defined as any of the following: high grade non-hematologic toxicity, or hematologic toxicity.

outcome_measures.name: Part 1: Severity of Adverse Events as Assessed by National Cancer Institute Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (NCI-CTCAE)
outcome_measures.description: Severity of AEs has 5 grades based on CTCAE criteria: Grade 1: Mild; Grade 2: Moderate; Grade 3: Severe; Grade 4: Life-threatening consequences; Grade 5: Death.

outcome_measures.name: Serum Prostate Specific Antigen (PSA) Concentration
outcome_measures.description: Serum prostate specific antigen (PSA) concentration will be assessed.

interventions.name: Drug, Food, Chemical or Biomedical Material

arms.name: Part 1: Dose Escalation
arms.description: Participants with metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer (mCRPC) will receive JNJ-63898081. Ascending dose levels will be sequentially tested.

arms.name: Part 2: Dose Expansion
arms.description: Participants with mCRPC or renal cell carcinoma (RCC) will receive JNJ-63898081 at the recommended Phase 2 dose (RP2D) determined in Part 1.

brief_summary:
The main purpose of this study are to determine the recommended Phase 2 dose (RP2D) regimen
      and the maximum tolerated dose, and to determine the safety of JNJ-63898081.
brief_title: A Study of JNJ-63898081 in Participants With Advanced Stage Solid Tumors
